question_text: Which of the following are potential limitations when installing M.2 NVMe drives? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Form factor length may exceed motherboard support
Drive must be formatted before physical installation
correct_answer: Form factor length may exceed motherboard support
explanation: M.2 NVMe drives may overheat, may not work in SATA-only slots, and must physically fit in the slot length. Formatting is done after installation.
